channel.title: Posts on My Fortunes

item.title: 2021-02-04T10:41:38Z
item.description: Do not sleep in a eucalyptus tree tonight.

item.description: Today is the first day of the rest of the mess.

item.title: 2021-02-04T09:54:06Z
item.description: Your boyfriend takes chocolate from strangers.

item.title: 2021-02-04T09:43:33Z
item.description: Stop! There was first a game of blindman’s buff. Of course there was. And I no more believe Topper was really blind than I believe he had eyes in his boots. My opinion is, that it was a done thing between him and Scrooge’s nephew; and that the Ghost of Christmas Present knew it. The way he went after that plump sister in the lace tucker, was an outrage on the credulity of human nature.

item.title: 2021-02-04T09:23:56Z
item.description: Your boss is a few sandwiches short of a picnic.

item.title: 2021-02-04T08:56:40Z
item.description: You’re ugly and your mother dresses you funny.

item.description: Try to relax and enjoy the crisis. – Ashleigh Brilliant

item.title: 2021-02-04T08:27:54Z
item.description: There is always one thing to remember: writers are always selling somebody out. – Joan Didion, “Slouching Towards Bethlehem”

item.title: 2021-02-04T07:56:50Z
item.description: You’re currently going through a difficult transition period called “Life.”

item.description: Q: How was Thomas J. Watson buried? A: 9 edge down.

item.description: You will receive a legacy which will place you above want.

item.title: 2021-02-04T07:22:04Z
item.description: Q: What’s tiny and yellow and very, very, dangerous? A: A canary with the super-user password.

item.description: You display the wonderful traits of charm and courtesy.

item.description: You fill a much-needed gap.

item.description: While you recently had your problems on the run, they’ve regrouped and are making another attack.

item.description: Don’t you wish you had more energy… or less ambition?

item.title: 2021-02-04T05:39:42Z
item.description: Q: Why did the WASP cross the road? A: To get to the middle.

item.title: 2021-02-04T05:23:22Z
item.description: Q: How many surrealists does it take to change a light bulb? A: Two, one to hold the giraffe, and the other to fill the bathtub with brightly colored machine tools. [Surrealist jokes just aren't my cup of fur. Ed.]

item.title: 2021-02-04T04:58:00Z
item.description: That secret you’ve been guarding, isn’t.

item.description: You will overcome the attacks of jealous associates.

item.title: 2021-02-04T04:29:19Z
item.description: Soap and education are not as sudden as a massacre, but they are more deadly in the long run. – Mark Twain

item.title: 2021-02-04T03:59:03Z
item.description: Delores breezed along the surface of her life like a flat stone forever skipping along smooth water, rippling reality sporadically but oblivious to it consistently, until she finally lost momentum, sank, and due to an overdose of flouride as a child which caused her to suffer from chronic apathy, doomed herself to lie forever on the floor of her life as useless as an appendix and as lonely as a five-hundred pound barbell in a steroid-free fitness center.

item.title: 2021-02-04T03:50:40Z
item.description: “I wonder”, he said to himself, “what’s in a book while it’s closed. Oh, I know it’s full of letters printed on paper, but all the same, something must be happening, because as soon as I open it, there’s a whole story with people I don’t know yet and all kinds of adventures and battles.” – Bastian B. Bux

item.description: You will be a winner today. Pick a fight with a four-year-old.

item.title: 2021-02-04T02:32:35Z
item.description: At once it struck me what quality went to form a man of achievement, especially in literature, and which Shakespeare possessed so enormously – I mean negative capability, that is, when a man is capable of being in uncertainties, mysteries, doubts, without any irritable reaching after fact and reason. – John Keats

item.title: 2021-02-04T01:24:17Z
item.description: October. This is one of the peculiarly dangerous months to speculate in stocks in. The others are July, January, September, April, November, May, March, June, December, August, and February. -- Mark Twain, "Pudd'nhead Wilson's Calendar"

item.title: 2021-02-04T00:46:28Z
item.description: After your lover has gone you will still have PEANUT BUTTER!

item.title: 2021-02-03T23:51:01Z
item.description: The only way to keep your health is to eat what you don’t want, drink what you don’t like, and do what you’d rather not. – Mark Twain

item.title: 2021-02-03T23:36:27Z
item.description: Q: How many journalists does it take to screw in a light bulb? A: Three. One to report it as an inspired government program to bring light to the people, one to report it as a diabolical government plot to deprive the poor of darkness, and one to win a Pulitzer prize for reporting that Electric Company hired a light bulb-assassin to break the bulb in the first place.

item.title: 2021-02-03T23:19:57Z
item.description: For courage mounteth with occasion. – William Shakespeare, “King John”

item.title: 2021-02-03T22:54:57Z
item.description: You will meet an important person who will help you advance professionally.

item.title: 2021-02-03T22:45:14Z
item.description: Q: What do you call 15 blondes in a circle? A: A dope ring. Q: Why do blondes put their hair in ponytails? A: To cover up the valve stem.

item.title: 2021-02-03T22:25:03Z
item.description: You are as I am with You.

item.description: There was a phone call for you.

item.description: You teach best what you most need to learn.

item.title: 2021-02-03T20:21:49Z
item.description: ROMEO: Courage, man; the hurt cannot be much. MERCUTIO: No, ‘tis not so deep as a well, nor so wide as a church-door; but ‘tis enough, ‘twill serve.

item.title: 2021-02-03T19:54:36Z
item.description: An exotic journey in downtown Newark is in your future.

item.title: 2021-02-03T19:44:52Z
item.description: "...The name of the song is called 'Haddocks' Eyes'!" "Oh, that's the name of the song, is it?" Alice said, trying to feel interested. “No, you don’t understand,” the Knight said, looking a little vexed. “That’s what the name is called. The name really is, ‘The Aged Aged Man.'” “Then I ought to have said “That’s what the song is called’?” Alice corrected herself. “No, you oughtn’t: that’s quite another thing!

item.title: 2021-02-03T19:27:38Z
item.description: You had some happiness once, but your parents moved away, and you had to leave it behind.

item.title: 2021-02-03T19:03:47Z
item.description: Sheriff Chameleotoptor sighed with an air of weary sadness, and then turned to Doppelgutt and said ‘The Senator must really have been on a bender this time – he left a party in Cleveland, Ohio, at 11:30 last night, and they found his car this morning in the smokestack of a British aircraft carrier in the Formosa Straits.’ – Grand Panjandrum’s Special Award, 1985 Bulwer-Lytton bad fiction contest.

item.title: 2021-02-03T18:38:29Z
item.description: You are a fluke of the universe; you have no right to be here.

item.title: 2021-02-03T18:00:56Z
item.description: FORTUNE PROVIDES QUESTIONS FOR THE GREAT ANSWERS: #15 A: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police. Q: What was the greatest achievement in taxidermy?

item.description: You will have good luck and overcome many hardships.

item.description: A Tale of Two Cities LITE(tm) – by Charles Dickens A man in love with a girl who loves another man who looks just like him has his head chopped off in France because of a mean lady who knits. Crime and Punishment LITE(tm) – by Fyodor Dostoevski A man sends a nasty letter to a pawnbroker, but later feels guilty and apologizes. The Odyssey LITE(tm) – by Homer

item.title: 2021-02-03T07:43:37Z
item.description: Try to have as good a life as you can under the circumstances.

item.title: 2021-02-03T07:21:31Z
item.description: Q: Why is Poland just like the United States? A: In the United States you can’t buy anything for zlotys and in Poland you can’t either, while in the U.S. you can get whatever you want for dollars, just as you can in Poland. – being told in Poland, 1987

item.title: 2021-02-03T06:50:44Z
item.description: You’re growing out of some of your problems, but there are others that you’re growing into.

item.description: You have a strong appeal for members of the opposite sex.

item.description: You’re ugly and your mother dresses you funny.

item.title: 2021-02-03T05:21:30Z
item.description: If your life was a horse, you’d have to shoot it.

item.title: 2021-02-03T04:51:20Z
item.description: I will honour Christmas in my heart, and try to keep it all the year. I will live in the Past, the Present, and the Future. The Spirits of all Three shall strive within me. I will not shut out the lessons that they teach. Oh, tell me that I may sponge away the writing on this stone! – Charles Dickens

item.title: 2021-02-03T04:26:06Z
item.description: If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all. – Oscar Wilde

item.title: 2021-02-03T03:55:20Z
item.description: The true Southern watermelon is a boon apart, and not to be mentioned with commoner things. It is chief of the world’s luxuries, king by the grace of God over all the fruits of the earth. When one has tasted it, he knows what the angels eat. It was not a Southern watermelon that Eve took; we know it because she repented. – Mark Twain, “Pudd’nhead Wilson’s Calendar”

item.title: 2021-02-03T03:33:36Z
item.description: Q: What’s a light-year? A: One-third less calories than a regular year.

item.title: 2021-02-03T03:02:43Z
item.description: Don’t worry. Life’s too long. – Vincent Sardi, Jr.

item.title: 2021-02-03T02:43:35Z
item.description: You will gain money by a speculation or lottery.

item.description: The first thing we do, let’s kill all the lawyers. – Wm. Shakespeare, “Henry VI”, Part IV

item.description: Something’s rotten in the state of Denmark. – Shakespeare

item.description: You will wish you hadn’t.

item.description: You have a deep interest in all that is artistic.

item.description: You definitely intend to start living sometime soon.

item.title: 2021-02-02T22:50:10Z
item.description: Have a place for everything and keep the thing somewhere else; this is not advice, it is merely custom. – Mark Twain

item.title: 2021-02-02T22:23:54Z
item.description: It is right that he too should have his little chronicle, his memories, his reason, and be able to recognize the good in the bad, the bad in the worst, and so grow gently old all down the unchanging days and die one day like any other day, only shorter. – Samuel Beckett, “Malone Dies”

item.title: 2021-02-02T21:52:20Z
item.description: There is an old time toast which is golden for its beauty. “When you ascend the hill of prosperity may you not meet a friend.” – Mark Twain

item.title: 2021-02-02T21:35:29Z
item.description: You will contract a rare disease.

item.title: 2021-02-02T21:18:31Z
item.description: Future looks spotty. You will spill soup in late evening.

item.title: 2021-02-02T20:54:23Z
item.description: You never know how many friends you have until you rent a house on the beach.

item.title: 2021-02-02T20:44:07Z
item.description: You will obey or molten silver will be poured into your ears.

item.title: 2021-02-02T20:21:26Z
item.description: Q: How many lawyers does it take to change a light bulb? A: Whereas the party of the first part, also known as “Lawyer”, and the party of the second part, also known as “Light Bulb”, do hereby and forthwith agree to a transaction wherein the party of the second part shall be removed from the current position as a result of failure to perform previously agreed upon duties, i.e., the lighting, elucidation, and otherwise illumination of the area ranging from the front (north) door, through the entryway, terminating at an area just inside the primary living area, demarcated by the beginning of the carpet, any spillover illumination being at the option of the party of the second part and not required by the aforementioned agreement between the parties.

item.title: 2021-02-02T20:03:27Z
item.description: You’re at the end of the road again.

item.description: Q: Why did the astrophysicist order three hamburgers? A: Because he was hungry.

item.title: 2021-02-02T19:46:22Z
item.description: Q: What is green and lives in the ocean? A: Moby Pickle.

item.title: 2021-02-02T19:05:24Z
item.description: Q: How many Martians does it take to screw in a light bulb? A: One and a half.

item.title: 2021-02-02T18:59:23Z
item.description: Stay away from hurricanes for a while.

item.title: 2021-02-02T18:39:07Z
item.description: The Least Successful Collector Betsy Baker played a central role in the history of collecting. She was employed as a servant in the house of John Warburton (1682-1759) who had amassed a fine collection of 58 first edition plays, including most of the works of Shakespeare. One day Warburton returned home to find 55 of them charred beyond legibility. Betsy had either burned them or used them as pie bottoms. The remaining three folios are now in the British Museum.

item.title: 2021-02-02T18:36:16Z
item.description: You will get what you deserve.

item.description: Q: Why don’t lawyers go to the beach? A: The cats keep trying to bury them.

item.description: Keep emotionally active. Cater to your favorite neurosis.

item.description: Your sister swims out to meet troop ships.

item.description: You should go home.

item.description: Don’t relax! It’s only your tension that’s holding you together.

item.description: All things that are, are with more spirit chased than enjoyed. – Shakespeare, “Merchant of Venice”

item.title: 2021-02-02T17:47:01Z
item.description: We were young and our happiness dazzled us with its strength. But there was also a terrible betrayal that lay within me like a Merle Haggard song at a French restaurant. […] I could not tell the girl about the woman of the tollway, of her milk white BMW and her Jordache smile. There had been a fight. I had punched her boyfriend, who fought the mechanical bulls. Everyone told him, “You ride the bull, senor.

item.description: Punning is the worst vice, and there’s no vice versa.

item.description: Nitwit ideas are for emergencies. You use them when you’ve got nothing else to try. If they work, they go in the Book. Otherwise you follow the Book, which is largely a collection of nitwit ideas that worked. – Larry Niven, “The Mote in God’s Eye”

item.description: Yow! I’m imagining a surfer van filled with soy sauce!

item.description: The best thing that comes out of Iowa is I-80.

item.description: “Not only is God dead, but just try to find a plumber on weekends.” –Woody Allen

item.description: Today is the last day of your life so far.

item.description: Absence is to love what wind is to fire. It extinguishes the small, it enkindles the great.

item.description: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning, and does not stop until you get to work.

item.description: Even a cabbage may look at a king.

item.description: The Illiterati Programus Canto 1: A program is a lot like a nose: Sometimes it runs, and sometimes it blows.

item.title: 2021-02-03T01:15:40+08:00
item.description: Look, we play the Star Spangled Banner before every game. You want us to pay income taxes, too? – Bill Veeck, Chicago White Sox

item.title: 2021-02-03T01:13:46+08:00
item.description: They are fools that think that wealth or women or strong drink or even drugs can buy the most in effort out of the soul of a man. These things offer pale pleasures compared to that which is greatest of them all, that task which demands from him more than his utmost strength, that absorbs him, bone and sinew and brain and hope and fear and dreams – and still calls for more.

item.title: 2021-02-02T17:11:43Z
item.description: My only love sprung from my only hate! Too early seen unknown, and known too late! – William Shakespeare, “Romeo and Juliet”

item.title: 2021-02-03T01:11:01+08:00
item.description: THE "FUN WITH USENET" MANIFESTO Very little happens on Usenet without some sort of response from some other reader. Fun With Usenet postings are no exception. Since there are some who might question the rationale of some of the excerpts included therein, I have written up a list of guidelines that sum up the philosophy behind these postings. One. I never cut out words in the middle of a quote without a VERY good reason, and I never cut them out without including ellipses.

item.title: 2021-02-02T17:05:03Z
item.description: Among the lucky, you are the chosen one.

item.title: 2021-02-02T16:58:15Z
item.description: You will not be elected to public office this year.

item.title: 2021-02-02T23:15:53+08:00
item.description: A CONS is an object which cares. – Bernie Greenberg.

item.title: 2021-02-02T23:15:28+08:00
item.description: “Flight Reservation systems decide whether or not you exist. If your information isn’t in their database, then you simply don’t get to go anywhere.” – Arthur Miller

item.title: 2021-01-31T23:40:43+08:00
item.description: When your memory goes, forget it!

item.title: 2021-01-31T22:47:27+08:00
item.description: My computer can beat up your computer. Karl Lehenbauer

item.title: 2021-01-31T22:27:46+08:00
item.description: “Atomic batteries to power, turbines to speed.” – Robin, The Boy Wonder

item.title: 2021-01-31T22:06:41+08:00
item.description: You go slow, be gentle. It’s no one-way street – you know how you feel and that’s all. It’s how the girl feels too. Don’t press. If the girl feels anything for you at all, you’ll know. – Kirk, “Charlie X”, stardate 1535.8

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:33:09+08:00
item.description: “Gotcha, you snot-necked weenies!” – Post Bros. Comics

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:28:01+08:00
item.description: When a place gets crowded enough to require ID’s, social collapse is not far away. It is time to go elsewhere. The best thing about space travel is that it made it possible to go elsewhere. – R.A. Heinlein, “Time Enough For Love”

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:24:52+08:00
item.description: You’ve been leading a dog’s life. Stay off the furniture.

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:19:14+08:00
item.description: An INK-LING? Sure – TAKE one!! Did you BUY any COMMUNIST UNIFORMS??

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:17:59+08:00
item.description: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it. Brian Kernighan

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:16:30+08:00
item.description: You’d better smile when they watch you, smile like you’re in control. – Smile, “Was (Not Was)”

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:04:22+08:00
item.description: The modern child will answer you back before you’ve said anything. – Laurence J. Peter

item.title: 2021-01-31T17:01:50+08:00
item.description: A CODE OF ETHICAL BEHAVIOR FOR PATIENTS: DO NOT EXPECT YOUR DOCTOR TO SHARE YOUR DISCOMFORT. Involvement with the patient’s suffering might cause him to lose valuable scientific objectivity. BE CHEERFUL AT ALL TIMES. Your doctor leads a busy and trying life and requires all the gentleness and reassurance he can get. TRY TO SUFFER FROM THE DISEASE FOR WHICH YOU ARE BEING TREATED. Remember that your doctor has a professional reputation to uphold.

item.title: 2021-01-31T16:55:25+08:00
item.description: There is nothing wrong with abstinence, in moderation.

item.title: 2021-01-31T16:46:22+08:00
item.description: Power is danger. – The Centurion, “Balance of Terror”, stardate 1709.2

item.title: 2021-01-31T16:45:12+08:00
item.description: Meade’s Maxim: Always remember that you are absolutely unique, just like everyone else.

item.title: 2021-01-31T16:44:38+08:00
item.description: Only through hard work and perseverance can one truly suffer.

item.description: A man always needs to remember one thing about a beautiful woman. Somewhere, somebody’s tired of her.

item.title: 2021-01-31T15:47:37+08:00
item.description: Anti-trust laws should be approached with exactly that attitude.

item.title: 2021-01-31T15:45:23+08:00
item.description: Our [softball] team usually puts the other woman at second base, where the maximum possible number of males can get there on short notice to help out in case of emergency. As far as I can tell, our second basewoman is a pretty good baseball player, better than I am, anyway, but there’s no way to know for sure because if the ball gets anywhere near her, a male comes barging over from, say, right field, to deal with it.

item.title: 2021-01-31T15:45:07+08:00
item.description: The final delusion is the belief that one has lost all delusions. – Maurice Chapelain, “Main courante”

item.description: Death is Nature’s way of recycling human beings.

item.description: ‘Scuse me, while I kiss the sky! – Robert James Marshall (Jimi) Hendrix

item.description: The judge fined the jaywalker fifty dollars and told him if he was caught again, he would be thrown in jail. Fine today, cooler tomorrow.

item.title: 2021-01-27T22:58:52+08:00
item.description: Nothing, nothing, nothing, no error, no crime is so absolutely repugnant to God as everything which is official; and why? because the official is so impersonal and therefore the deepest insult which can be offered to a personality. – Soren Kierkegaard
